newsitem.title: USA: USDA allows field work in advance of CRP expiry.
newsitem.headline: USDA allows field work in advance of CRP expiry.

text.p: Farmers will be allowed to begin field preparations for fall-planted crops in advance of expiration of Conservation Reserve contracts, U.S. Agriculture Department officials said Wednesday.

As in the past, field preparation can begin 90 days prior to expiration without any penalty on rental payment. Work can begin as early as May 1 in arid areas but two months' rent must be forfeited for such an early start.
Farmers can use the "early out" option at any point. Payment would be prorated to the date land left the reserve. Contract years begin each Oct 1.
